position: Intern Opportunities for Undergraduate Students: Customer Success Account Manager & Customer Engineer
description:
As a service professional, you will be a strategic advisor to Microsoft’s enterprise customers and partners helping them optimize their business performance and be on the front line dedicated to solving their technical challenges. You will possess a solid understanding of your customer’s business, industry and needs as cloud and emerging technologies enable digital transformation opportunities for their organizations. You will be responsible for delivering solutions to enable the customer’s desired outcomes, working closely with other teams.

Do you want to work on a meaningful and impactful project and make a difference? Are you willing to learn from others and open to new ideas? Do you want to support others to succeed and operate in a highly collaborative and global environment? If this sounds like you, Microsoft would like to invite you to come join us as you are, where you can find more than just a job.

Applications to these opportunities are considered for the roles described below, depending on education level and/or location. To be considered for an internship position, you need to currently be enrolled full-time as a student majoring in an applicable field (with at least one semester/quarter remaining after a summer 2021 internship).


Responsibilities


Customer Success Account Manager

As a Customer Success Account Manager (CSAM), you are the primary customer facing role responsible for customer success through the management of program deliveries and strong customer relationships. The prevailing business priority is the customers’ successful adoption and productive use of Microsoft cloud technologies. You are front and center with our customers supporting their digital journey and empowering them to achieve more!

Customer Success Account Managers drive quality planning and delivery of Support services to realize customer business outcomes and overall experience with Microsoft solutions. CSAMs partner with customer and Account Team to prioritize and plan customer engagements and programs, driving outcomes to improve the health, performance, and business capabilities of the prioritized workloads. CSAMs drive orchestration, customer sponsor management, and stakeholder communication of prioritized engagements and programs. The CSAM also tracks, escalates, and plans for the remediation of technical blockers and provides engineering feedback to further our product and solutions, as appropriate.

As a CSAM intern, you will work very closely with a CSAM mentor to understand the CSAM role. You will also complete one or more projects throughout your internship that will accelerate your learning and drive business impact.

Customer Engineer

Customer Engineers (CEs) are deep technical advisors supporting Enterprise customers to deliver unique value by removing blockers to consumption within their given Solution Area. CEs provide technical support including risk assessments and tuning to operate and optimize a customer’s cloud or on-premises environment. The Customer Engineer provides support delivery services as well as technical readiness through a Customer’s Support contract via dispatch by the account team. Customer Engineer services can be delivered either remotely or on-premises.

CEs participate in proactive account management, spot performance issues, analyze problems, develop solutions to meet customer needs and represent them. The CE provides the most effective method of service delivery by analyzing trends and common themes across customers and seeks information about the underlying needs of customers. CEs cultivate relationships, credibility, and loyalty with customers and partners intentionally by sharing relevant business expertise. The CE identifies opportunities to articulate business value and grow customer/partner relationships in alignment with Customer Success business priorities and stakeholder management principles.

As a Customer Engineer, you will work very closely with a CE mentor to understand the CE role. You will also complete one or more projects throughout your internship that will accelerate your learning and drive business impact.


Qualifications


· Currently pursuing bachelor's or master’s degree in business, computer science, computer engineering, IT, electrical engineering, management information systems, or related fields (with at least one semester/quarter remaining after a summer 2021 internship)

· Microsoft Product Certification, MCSE or other technical certifications preferred

· Ability to manage executive relationships, both internally and with customers, to create business transformation

· Excellent communication skills and superior customer-service skills desired

Ability to work independently with minimal management supervision and as part of regional/virtual teams

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

position: National Advisory - Los Angeles - PI Technology Transformation Intern - Summer
description:
EY provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law. EY is a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services. The insights and quality services we deliver help build trust and confidence in the capital markets and in economies the world over. We develop outstanding leaders who team to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders. In so doing, we play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities.

EY Advisory Services is a fast-moving, high-growth service area with huge potential. It offers variety, challenge, responsibility and the opportunity to realize your leadership potential. While our Advisory team comprises two main businesses – Performance Improvement and RISK – we serve our clients by building integrated teams from each of these two areas. We assist clients to drive business-led and technology-enabled transformation across a broad range of business issues. We are committed to “building a better working world” with a focus on improving business performance and managing risk.

An introduction to Performance Improvement

Our Performance Improvement team is all about helping clients improve security and efficiency, while also reducing their costs. We help clients by delivering assessment, transformation and process efficiency solutions in a variety of specialty areas.

Finance

Our Finance teams focus on improving the performance of clients’ finance organizations and their businesses as a whole. We help organizations achieve strategic alignment of their finance organization, implement service and cost-improvement initiatives and embed a performance management process and culture that unites the business around its core objectives.

Requirements for a position with the Finance team include the following:
Pursuing a master’s degree with an emphasis in Finance, Accounting, Statistics, Economics, MIS (business perspective) and/or Business is preferred
Experience in providing advisory services in the finance function and other operational areas that impact the finance function (e.g., order to cash; procure to pay; close to report; budgeting and planning, shared services/outsourcing)
Work locations include: Atlanta, Chicago, Cleveland, Dallas, Houston, Los Angeles, McLean, New York, Philadelphia, San Francisco
Analytics



Our Analytics teams assist clients by effectively and efficiently leveraging a set of technology enabled management and analytic processes that help businesses to operationalize strategic goals by measuring and managing risk and performance against those goals. Analytics is about creating measurable performance improvement through the use of the right information focusing on: business intelligence, information strategy and management, and risk and performance analytics. We also link enterprise information to business strategy to enable organizations to deliver superior business results.

Requirements for a position with the Analytics team fit one of two profiles:

Profile 1: Advanced Analytics
Proficiency in using one or more the following analytics tools to address a business problem; ACL, CPLEX, Tableau, Spotfire, Microsoft SQL Server, SPSS, SAS, and R
Preferred experience in any of the following: statistics and statistical modeling, operations research, linear regression, optimization, exploratory data mining and data visualization
Profile 2: Information Management
Must have experience working with ETL processes and objectives
Proven experience within the analytics domain gathering business and technical requirements, solution design and build, testing and solution deployment
Preferred experience in several of the following areas: data architecture, information governance, data integration, data quality, master data management, reporting and analytics, enterprise content management and knowledge management.
Both Profiles:
Experience actively participating in brainstorming, identifying core issues and effectively finding and using data to manage complex analysis
External client delivery and solution knowledge spanning data management, data warehousing and reporting/analytics domains
Pursuing a master’s degree with an emphasis in Analytics, Finance, Accounting, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, IT, Mathematics, MIS, Operations Research or Industrial Engineering preferred.
Work locations include: Atlanta, Chicago, Dallas, Houston, Los Angeles, New York, San Francisco
Enterprise Performance Management



Our Enterprise Performance Management team helps clients develop strategies as well as design and implement solutions that focus on improving their financial processes and enabling technologies. EPM includes the following core management processes: Enterprise Planning & Forecasting, Financial Close & Consolidations, Driver Based Performance, Management, Cost Management & Profitability, Balance Scorecard, Financial & Managerial Reporting.

Requirements for a position with the EPM team include the following:
Pursuing a master’s degree with an emphasis in Finance, Accounting, Economics, MIS, Computer Science and/or Business preferred
Exposure to implementation in one or more of the following EPM software applications (including design and configuration): Oracle Hyperion (Hyperion Planning, Hyperion Financial Management (HFM), Essbase), SAP (BPC) or Cognos (Enterprise Planning/TM1, Cognos Controller) preferred
Strong combined background in Finance and Information Technology
Work locations include; Atlanta, Chicago, Dallas, Houston, Los Angeles, McLean, New York, San Francisco
Supply Chain



Our Supply Chain teams provide insights into supply chain transformation. They cover sourcing, procurement, inbound logistics, engineering, manufacturing, final assembly, and product service and delivery. This team focuses on helping clients run their supply chains effectively in order to improve their business performance.

Requirements for a position with the Supply Chain team include the following:
Pursuing a master’s degree with an emphasis in Engineering, Economics, Business, Supply Chain and Logistics is preferred
Experience in providing advisory services in the supply chain and other operational areas that impact the supply chain function (e.g., assessments, supply chain strategy, distribution/logistics (inbound, outbound, return), inventory management, procurement and sourcing, lean-six sigma, sales and operations planning, cost reduction)
Work locations include: Atlanta, Chicago, Cincinnati, Dallas, Denver, Detroit, Houston, Los Angeles, McLean, New York, Philadelphia, San Francisco
Customer



Our Customer teams focus on assisting our clients with understanding the characteristics and needs of current and potential customer groups, aligning the organization, processes and products to meet the needs of and effectively service the various customer groups, creating optimal customer experiences through better use of technology, improved processes and proficient service representatives and developing measures to evaluate key performance indicators and impact to the business.

Requirements for a position with the Customer team include the following:
Pursuing a master’s degree with an emphasis in Marketing, Management, Consulting or Finance is preferred
Experience in providing advisory or consulting services in the sales, marketing, order management and/or customer service functions
Work locations include: Atlanta, Chicago, Houston, Los Angeles, McLean, New York, San Francisco
Health Care

Our Health Care teams focus on supporting both providers and payers in addressing challenges facing the healthcare industry, and provide advisory services in the following areas to address key Senior Leadership issues: Revenue cycle, reimbursement/regulatory, Medicare and Medicaid compliance finance transformation, supply chain, health informatics/clinical insights, managed care-provider and managed care-payer operations. We support both providers and payers in addressing challenges facing the health care industry.

Requirements for a position with the Health Care team include the following:
Pursuing a degree with an emphasis in Health Administration, Health Informatics, Finance and/or Business; a graduate degree (MBA, MHA, MPH, MS Health Information, MS - Health Information Management, MS Business Analytics), with an undergraduate degree in engineering, computer science, management, science, operations research, production/operations management, economics, statistics, mathematics or industrial/organizational psychology is preferred.
Experience with health care organizations, emr implementation, mergers and acquisitions, physician alignment or financial margin improvement initiatives, including the ability to examine the efficiency, profits and structure of an organization, or optimizing care delivery through the use of health information or analytics is desirable.
Work Locations include: Atlanta, Boston, Charlotte, Chicago, Cleveland, Dallas, DC, Los Angeles, McLean, New York, Philadelphia, San Francisco,
People & Organizational Change

Our People & Organization Change teams focus on assisting our clients in successfully managing and sustaining people, process and/or technology change by focusing on the following: Visioning/translating the business case into a compelling case for change; sponsor and leadership alignment that elevates their skills as drivers of change; Stakeholder management that is engaging and inclusive; Communication that is targeted and interactive; Organization alignment, which links processes, governance, structure and culture with the future; Workforce strategy and talent development to minimize disruptions and equip people with skills for new roles; Human Resources processes and measures to support, incent and reward desired behaviors.

Requirements for a position with the People & Organizational Change team include the following:
Pursuing a master’s degree with an emphasis in Business, Human Resources, Psychology, Finance, Accounting, Statistics, Economics and MIS (business perspective) preferred
Experience in providing people and organization change advisory services in large-scale, end-to-end transformations: areas of focus would include: Visioning and Strategy workshop design and delivery, Leadership Alignment and Development, Stakeholder Management, Communications, Operating Model and Organizational Design, Governance, Training, Competency Assessment, Workforce Strategies, Talent Management and Culture Change
Work Locations: Atlanta, Chicago, Dallas, Houston, Los Angeles, McLean, New York, San Francisco,
Strategy

Our Strategy teams work with senior client executives on issues that cut across the enterprise and have a fundamental impact on business performance. We help clients by delivering solutions in areas such as: innovation and digital transformation, growth strategy, operating model design, strategic investment analysis, and enterprise transformation.

Requirements for a position with the Strategy team include the following:
Pursuing a master’s degree with an emphasis in Business Administration, Quantitative Discipline (e.g., economics) , Engineering, Analytics, Design Architecture, Technology, Media & Advertising, or Finance preferred
An analytical mindset and an ability to take abstract questions and issues and structure them into manageable, specific work streams. Ability to use reason, logic and creativity to structure and solve ambiguous problems. Experience with innovation and digital strategy preferred.
Work locations include: Atlanta, Chicago, Denver, Los Angeles, San Francisco, New York
Program Management

Our Program Management teams provide comprehensive services to design build and operate large complex transformational programs, including the following: PMO design, build and operate; Program transformation project management; Program delivery effectiveness.

Requirements for a position with the Program Management team include the following:
Pursuing a master’s degree with an emphasis in Finance, Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering and/or Business (Operations or Project Management) is preferred
Experiences as a team lead on large scale complex programs with exposure to the following: PMO Support, Project Management, Program Development/Testing, Business Requirements Analysis, Quality Assurance and large ERP implementation
PMP is preferred
Work Locations include: Chicago, Dallas, New York, San Francisco
What this means for you

With each engagement, you can expect to build leadership, communication and client-management skills, as well as sharpen your problem-solving capabilities. Once you have developed a strong foundation, we will work with you to determine a more specific area of concentration for the next phase of your career journey. If you are interested in “building a better working world,” being part of a dynamic team, serving clients and reaching your full potential, EY Advisory Services is for you. Apply today!

Responsibilities of Interns may include:
Establish relationships with client personnel at appropriate levels. Consistently deliver quality client services. Monitor progress, manage risk and ensure key stakeholders are kept informed about progress and expected outcomes. Stay abreast of current business and industry trends relevant to the client’s business
Demonstrate in-depth technical capabilities and professional knowledge. Demonstrate ability to assimilate to new knowledge. Possess good business acumen. Remain current on new developments in advisory services capabilities and industry knowledge
To qualify, candidates must be or have:
A bachelor’s degree and approximately 3-6 years of related work experience
Pursuing a MBA,MS, MHA or MPA degree
Excellent verbal and written communication/presentation skills
Demonstrated characteristics of a forward thinker and self-motivator who thrives on new challenges and adapts to learning new knowledge
Strong decision-making, problem-solving skills and the ability to adapt and learn analytic methodology
Able to work collaboratively in a team environment
A strong work ethic with ability to grow and flex, as industry trends and EY business dictates
A history of driving revenue within existing clients and in developing new prospects at the “C” level of Fortune 500 companies
A willingness to travel on short notice to meet client needs, including a willingness to travel internationally; travel is estimated at 80%
A valid US driver’s license and passport
EY provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.


Job Description


Haven’t heard of Arm before? If you have a smartphone, digital camera, digital TV, gaming console or a smart meter at home, you’ve already used an Arm powered product. See, you do know us! Our technology is literally transforming the way people live their lives. From the unmissable to the invisible, our advanced processor designs have enabled 35 billion Arm technology-based chips to date (that’s 125 products shipped every second!)

If you have a willingness to learn and a passion for software development, you could be working with the technology that powers 95% of the world’s connected devices. We’re hiring interns across multiple positions and departments for Summer 2021, spanning our US offices Austin, TX, Boston, MA, or San Jose, CA.


Job Requirements


What will you be doing?

Work in various groups and departments across the company. You should be flexible with a variety of software development skills as well as the commitment to extend the breadth and depth of your knowledge

What do we need from you?
You’ll be currently enrolled in a bachelor’s or master’s program in computer engineering or computer science (or a related field)
You can work full-time for a minimum of 12-weeks in Summer 2021
You’ll have experience with C, C++, or Python
You’ll have knowledge of CPU micro-architecture concepts
You’ll have experience with code development in a multi core/threaded platform
What you’ll get in return
When you join Arm, you won’t be overwhelmed by bean bags and slides. Instead, you will see a high trust, supportive and flexible working environment where we invest in you and your working experience and also in you and your happiness outside of the day job. With an organic culture of imagination, ingenuity, and fun - life at Arm is where people “work to live, rather than live to work.”
You’ll get the opportunity to work closely with some of the industry’s most talented and expert engineers who will support and mentor you.
You’ll get to work in a fast-paced, intellectually stimulating working environment where you can gain noteworthy experience.
You’ll get to work in some of our best office spaces in the US that include things like a farm to table café with video games, foosball, ping pong, basketball court, a gym etc.


Benefits


Your particular benefits package will depend on position and type of employment and may be subject to change. Your package will be confirmed on offer of employment. Arm’s benefits program provides permanent employees with the opportunity to stay innovative and healthy, ensure the wellness of their families, and create a positive working environment.
Annual Bonus Plan
Discretionary Cash Awards
401(k), 100% matching on first 6% eligible earnings
Medical, Dental & Vision, 100% coverage for employee only, shared cost for dependents
Basic Life and Accidental Death and Dismemberment Insurance (AD&D)
Short Term (STD) and Long Term (LTD) Disability Insurance
Vacation, 20 days per year with option to buy 5 more.
Holidays, 13 days per year
Sabbatical, 20 paid days every four-years of service
Sick Leave, 7 days per year
Volunteering, four hours per month (TeamARM)
Office location dependent: café on site, fitness facilities, team and social events
Additional benefits include: Flexible Spending Accounts for health and dependent care, EAP, Health Advocate, Business Travel Accident Program & Commuter programs.
ARM, Inc. (USA) participates in E-Verify. For more information, please refer to www.dhs.gov/E-Verify


About Arm


Arm® technology is at the heart of a computing and connectivity revolution that is transforming the way people live and businesses operate. From the unmissable to the invisible; our advanced, energy-efficient processor designs are enabling the intelligence in 86 billion silicon chips and securely powering products from the sensor to the smartphone to the supercomputer. With more than 1,000 technology partners including the world’s most famous business and consumer brands, we are driving Arm innovation into all areas compute is happening inside the chip, the network and the cloud.

With offices around the world, Arm is a diverse community of dedicated, innovative and highly talented professionals. By enabling an inclusive, meritocratic and open workplace where all our people can grow and succeed, we encourage our people to share their unique contributions to Arm's success in the global marketplace.


About the office


The Arm Austin office employs staff from across all divisions of ARM and is considered the engineering hub for North America. Austin has the nickname of “Silicon Hills” thanks to the high number of tech companies in the area, and is also known as the “Live Music Capital of the World". Events such as South by Southwest, Austin City Limits Music Festival and the F1 Grand Prix are but a few of the many activities that make Austin a top destination for both residents and travelers.

Job Description


Software Developer Intern

OSIsoft is a growing company that is dedicated to keeping a small business feel while maintaining global outreach. We hire smart people, and trust them to make the right decisions for the organization, and the customer. OSIsoft provides the best aspects of a startup, such as direct access to customers, learning and training opportunities, new technology, and challenging engineering problems, as well as the stability of a company devoted to being around for the next 40 years.

As a Software Developer Intern, you will:
Join one of our small, energetic development teams
Work on tasks a full-time developer would work on
Be responsible for designing, coding, testing, documenting, and supporting our software products
You may enjoy this if:
You have a passion for creating software
You like problem solving and have sharp debugging skills
You are creative with computers and software applied to engineering
We’re looking for:
Self-motivated individuals with a passion for creating software
Students currently enrolled in a full-time Bachelor's Degree, Master's Degree or PhD program
Candidates that major in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Math, Engineering or related field
GPA 3.0 or above
Intern applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full time basis. OSIsoft is not able to sponsor applicants for work visas.
Software development experience in one or more modern programming languages: C, C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, or Python
Benefits:
Mentorship: You will be assigned a technical mentor to guide you during your internship
Continuous Learning: In agile software development, defensive programming, C++/C#/.Net framework, Visual Studio/TFS/MTN, and the Microsoft Windows platform, HTML5/JavaScript and more
Dates:
May 17, 2021 to August 6, 2021
June 28, 2021 to September 10, 2021
About OSIsoft

OSIsoft is a global leader in operational intelligence. We deliver an open enterprise infrastructure, the PI System™, to connect sensor-based data, systems and people. OSIsoft has installations in 127 countries and is widely used across manufacturing, energy, utilities, pharmaceuticals, life sciences, data centers, facilities and the process industries, as well as the public sector and the federal government. OSIsoft is headquartered in San Leandro, California, U.S.A, with offices around the world.

At OSIsoft, we provide the industry standard in enterprise infrastructure for management of time series data through the OSIsoft PI System™. Our customers rely upon the PI System™ to safeguard data and deliver enterprise-wide visibility into operational, manufacturing and business information. The PI System™ enables users to manage assets, mitigate risks, comply with regulations, improve processes, drive innovation, make business decisions in real time, and to identify competitive business and market opportunities. We are time series data; if the data has a value at a given time, we collect it, store it, and show it to our customers whenever they need it! We let engineers and managers see exactly what’s going on in their processes in real time – useful, right?

OSIsoft is an equal opportunity employer and is an affirmative action employer. Adhering to our tenets, we are pathfinders, we are honest, and we respect people: our customers, partners, and especially our employees. We are committed to an inclusive workplace and accept applications without regard to race, religious creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression or gender characteristic, national origin, religion, marital status, medical condition, physical or mental disability, military service or veteran status, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, or any other classification protected by federal, state, and local laws and ordinances. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

#LI-BJ1

Group One Trading, LP, a dynamic options trading firm, is actively seeking motivated individuals, who work well in high-pressure environments, to support our operations on the Chicago Board Options Exchange. Although knowledge of the options industry is an obvious asset, we are seeking college students from a wide range of backgrounds, specifically in the areas of mathematics, economics, physics, engineering or computer science. Candidates should be comfortable working in a trading environment, and possess excellent communication, analytical, computer, problem-solving, and time management skills. Successful Interns will have an opportunity to be accepted into our full-time Trading Analyst class, where they will learn the intricacies of options trading and the skills needed to make a successful career in market making.

Our training program teaches analysts the essentials of stock options trading and the skills that make for a successful career on the trading floor. Trading Analysts will be employed as option floor associates and receive a guaranteed salary during their time in the program, with the expectation that 'graduates' will go on to become Junior Traders then onto highly compensated Group One Traders.

EXPECTATIONS
Keen awareness of critical situations, ability to shift from fast market to slow market conditions quickly and efficiently.
Anticipate the needs of traders throughout the day, quick comprehension and delivery of tasks.
Balance/resolve position discrepancies before opening bell; notify trading staff of unexpected position changes intra-day.
Ability to filter information to trading staff by necessity; reporting pertinent information to management in a timely fashion.
Interns are required to articulately voice needs of the trading staff to IT, vendors, clearing firm, brokers/other market makers, and the exchange if necessary.
To be well versed with all methods of communication provided by Group One these may include but are not limited to IM, telephone, and email.
Excellent computer skills including some programming skills. They should become fluent with both the usage and rules of all applications that provide market research, theoretical/analytical data, order entry applications, and stock/option execution.
Retention of knowledge and ability to apply past experience to current situations is critical.
Excellent math, probability, game theory skills.

Welcome to Planet. We believe in using space to help life on Earth.

Planet designs, builds, and operates the largest constellation of imaging satellites in history. This constellation delivers an unprecedented dataset of empirical information via a revolutionary cloud-based platform to authoritative figures in commercial, environmental, and humanitarian sectors. We are both a space company and data company all rolled into one.

Customers and users across the globe use Planet's data to develop new technologies, drive revenue, power research, and solve our world's toughest obstacles.

As we control every component of hardware design, manufacturing, data processing, and software engineering, our office is a truly inspiring mix of experts from a variety of domains.

We have a people-centric approach toward culture and community and we strive to iterate in a way that puts our team members first and prepares our company for growth. Join Planet and be a part of our mission to change the way people see the world.

Planet is headquartered in San Francisco, California, Earth.

About the Planet Impact in STEM Program:

Are you looking to balance your computer science or coding education with real-world experience? In the fall of 2020, for the first time, Planet is piloting an internship program that seeks to benefit members of historically marginalized and underrepresented groups within STEM. In the 16 weeks that you're with us, you'll have access to Planet's internal resources to help support you in having a great experience working remotely at Planet, whether you're working in a part- or full-time capacity. You'll join your team alongside a cohort of other fellows, while becoming a part of an inclusive culture that thrives on collaboration and launching new ideas. If using space to help life on earth sounds like a fulfilling avenue to apply your growing coding skills, apply below! As part of your submission we want to hear YOUR story. Also, please include how you see this program complementing your concurrent instruction and if you are available full-time. We are excited to hear from you!

Location: Oakland, Detroit, Atlanta

Duration: September 28, 2020 - February 5, 2021

Pay Rate: $25/hour

About the Role:

Quality Assurance interns will be an integral part of our development team, and act as internal customers. They work on broader aspects of the platform making sure all the pieces are working well in-sync before product releases.

You will interface and work with cross functional teams to cultivate a good grasp of each feature, common customer workflows and testability. This role will be involved in different phases of the software development life cycle, reviewing requirements to creating and automating tests. On a given day work could span from creating test scenarios, test automation, exploratory testing and verification of issues.

Impact You'll Own:
Opportunity to work on testing Core platform, web applications and Analytics features within software engineering.
Your work will ensure customers use high quality features
With automation test coverage, teams receive quick feedback on the current state of application.
This role will be integrated to a scrum team, working closely with Product owners, Developers and Quality Engineers.
What You Bring:
Create, maintain automation test scripts using test framework.
Work with developers and Quality engineers to ensure product quality.
Write test scenarios, validate new features before release.
Document issues in defect tracking system, verify them after resolution
Willing to learn new technologies, alignment with existing priorities.
You Should Have:
Python programming or similar
Basic git and unix skills
Exposure to Quality Assurance fundamentals and process
Interest in testing, user experience and quality in general
Some Press About Us:

Our CEO, Will Marshall featured on TED and featured in a Planet Blog

"Planet: Bringing Space Back Down to Earth"

Tiny, privately owned satellites are changing how we view the Earth features in NBC News

"Planet And Rocket Lab Create Mission Patch To Honor Women In Aerospace" —Planet Blog

Why we care so much about Belonging.

We're dedicated to helping the whole Planet, and to do that we must strive to represent all of it within each of our offices and on all of our teams. That's why Planet is guided by an ultimate north star of Belonging, dreaming big as we approach our ongoing work with diversity, equity and inclusion. If this job intrigues you, but you're thinking you might not have all the qualifications, please... do apply! At Planet, we are looking for well-rounded people from around the world who can contribute to more ways than just what is listed in this job description. We don't just fill positions, we aspire to fulfill people's careers, most excited about folks who are motivated by our underlying humanitarian efforts. We are a few orbits around the sun before we get to where we want to be, so we hope you're excited to come along for the ride.

1901 Group is a creative, high energy company shaping the future of how organizations monitor and manage their IT environment. 1901 Group provides innovative IT services using a cloud-based platform that enables monitoring, management, and optimization of our customer’s IT environments regardless if their assets are in the cloud, on-premise, or in both. Basic understanding of video display systems and projectors
Proficiency with troubleshooting MAC OSX, Windows 7, and Windows 10 operating systems.
Proficiency with troubleshooting Laptops, Desktops, iPhone, Android, Blackberry, and Mac hardware.
Experience with PC Imaging
Basic Active Directory experience/knowledge
Methodical and detail oriented
Professional, positive, and cheerful demeanor
Strong problem solving and communication skills
Self-driven, independent, and highly motivated
Willingness to work flexible hours – shift work required including weekend shift hours

High School Diploma or equivalent.
Pursuing undergraduate degree in Computer Science or related technical field.

The ultimate source for official answers about a business online should be the business itself. However, when consumers ask questions on company websites, too often they are left in the dark with wrong answers. Yext (NYSE: YEXT), the Search Experience Cloud, solves this problem by organizing a business's facts so it can provide official answers to consumer questions — wherever people search. Starting with the company website, then extending across search engines and voice assistants, businesses around the world, like Taco Bell, Marriott, and Jaguar Land Rover—as well as organizations like the U.S. State Department—trust Yext to radically improve the search experience on their websites and across the entire search ecosystem.

There are 2 engineering teams in our office, as described below. Our interview is a general interview in consideration for a role in either team. If you join either team, you will work alongside engineers from the top universities and tech companies in the world, hands-on with the code from day one.

Team #1 - Consulting engineering

Yext Consulting is looking for Full Stack Software Engineers to join a fast-paced, cross-functional team working to deliver customized Yext products for our largest enterprise customers. Consulting SWEs work with engagement managers and designers to deliver customized Yext Pages, Data Integrations, Dashboards, and other solutions for Fortune 500 level clients. Our tech stack includes Closure Templates (soy), SCSS, ES6 JavaScript, Node.js, Go, and Java. We take pride in our ability to tackle any engineering challenge and keep pace with the ever-changing needs of our clients and the market. We value engineers that have a passion for technology (particularly front end development), display a willingness to jump in, and are excited to be part of a cross-functional, client-facing team.

What You'll Do
Build customized, high-quality consumer-facing web applications while ensuring compatibility across multiple browsers and platforms
Augment development tooling to improve engineering quality-of-life, automation, iteration speed, and maintainability using modern technologies like Go, Node.js, Grunt, Webpack, SASS, and more
Write clean, tested, and well-documented code
Proactively contribute ideas for new features and identify areas for improvement
Collaborate effectively across teams, including outside of engineering
Effectively communicate technical concepts including architectures, best practices, implementation options, compatibility issues and tradeoffs to fellow engineers and non-technical stakeholders alike.
What You Have
Pursuing a degree in Computer Science or related technical field, graduating between December 2021 and August 2022
Familiar with at least one of the following languages: Java, Python, Go, C++, or JavaScript
Ability to easily move between backend and frontend technologies
Openness to new technologies and creative solutions
Comfortable working within a fast-paced high growth environment
Contribution to open source projects
Team #2 - Technology engineering

We're looking for Software Engineers to join the Yext Engineering team and drive the technology behind our revolutionary product offering! Our team works in an agile environment running two-week sprints that culminate with demos of features in progress. You will work alongside engineers from the top universities and tech companies in the world, hands-on with the code from day one.

What You'll Do
Participate in full life-cycle software development
Design, implement, and deploy highly distributed and scalable systems
Contribute ideas for new features and identify areas for improvement proactively
Immerse yourself into the Yext culture and ecosystem by following our engineering motto: "Think Big, Learn Fast, and Get Stuff Done"
What You Have
Pursuing a degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, graduating between December 2021 and August 2022
Excellent implementation skills in a OOP language (We mostly use Java and Go)
Fast learner who picks up new technologies quickly
Ability to work productively in a collaborative team environment
Comfortable working within a fast-paced environment

position: Data Science and Analytics Intern - Summer
description:
Position Description:
The world is our stage; the sky is the limit. At Lenovo, we believe smarter technology takes a global mindset with trust and respect for one another, enabling us to do exciting and rewarding work that intelligently transforms our world. We are recognized as one of the world’s Most Admired & Best Regarded Companies, a Top 100 Global Tech Leader, #1 in PC sales, and rank #224 on the Fortune Global 500. This is a place where ideas grow, initiative wins, and achievements are seen. We love the work we get to do and we believe that Smarter takes YOU!

Are you someone with a passion for data, analytics, insights and technology? Do you want to be part of a team lighting up actionable insights to help the organization make business decisions? Lenovo's Digital Analytics team is looking for a passionate, creative, analytical and experienced data science intern who loves big data, curious to explore and unveil insights and create a business story to impact key business decisions. Our team plays a key role in providing data analytics and business insights to WW eCommerce stakeholders and owns the end to end decision sciences charter that includes:
• bringing the relevant data into a central system to create the single version of truth
• creating key metrics, reports and dashboards to support business health
• building advanced analytical models (behavior segmentation, churn prediction, purchase propensity, recommendation engine, etc. that spans over sales, marketing, partners, finance and engineering areas.

Responsibilities:
• Provide internal and external data and perform analytics tasks in support of Lenovo's BU's and regional sales teams.
• Participate in all activities based on corporate analytics vision and strategy intended to serve both internal business as well as to create value for eCommerce stakeholders
• Responsible for exploring and experimenting with a variety of datasets to draw insights and search for stories within sales funnel as well as recommend changes in tactics to drive business decisions
• Model and build algorithms on top of our vast number of datasets.
• Develop deeper understanding of internal and external data and systems.

Lenovo is a $50+ billion global Fortune 250 company and leader in providing innovative consumer, commercial and enterprise technology. Our portfolio of high-quality, secure products and services covers PCs, workstations, servers, storage, smart TVs and a family of mobile products like smartphones, tablets and apps. Everyone here at Lenovo is an integral part of the company, working together, across continents, cultures and innovations, all comprised in a friendly, fast-paced, work environment that focuses on one common goal: to be known as the best in what we do.

We're looking to add talented individuals who are self-motivated and desire boundless opportunities, to join us. Come share in the discoveries that are forged from our shared achievements at Lenovo as we drive the next generation in technology.


Position Requirements:
Required Qualifications:
• Pursuing Bachelor’s / Master's Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Information Systems or Statistics.

Preferred Qualifications:
• Ability to manage multiple active projects proceeding in parallel.
• Driven by the desire to seek answer to "so what?" business question than being enamored by "what’s new?"
• Excellent listening, verbal, written, and presentation skills.
• Ability to quickly assimilate relevant information in unfamiliar situations.
• Ability to develop creative approaches and solutions necessary to resolve complex problems.
• Ability to use a vast array of analytical tools.
• Demonstrated ability to source data across a variety of structured and unstructured data sources.
• Demonstrated ability to work under time constraints while delivering incremental value.
• Producing high quality work for business presentations and reports.
• Demonstrated ability to work in a team environment with minimal supervision.
• Excellent business acumen and sound judgment.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Asurions internship program is a 12-week internship to help rising seniors get a sneak peek into the technology world. Assigned to a team, interns will have their own projects to complete and present to leadership at the end of the summer. The program will provide the intern with a unique strategic perspective, professional and personal development along the way, and experiences to enhance their academic learnings. Our goal is to allow for the intern to make contributions throughout the summer through project work, presentations and networking. Are you ready to join our award-winning virtual internship? We are looking for interns who are curious, humble and eager to learn which is the way we all approach the design work we do.


Asurions Internship:
Open to rising seniors currently enrolled in undergrad pursuing a degree related to internship duties or major below.
Duration of virtual internship is 12 weeks from May 17th to August 6th 2021.
Continuous learning and tailored on the job training in technology, product development and/or supply chain management.
Exposure to senior leadership including but not limited to onboarding, learning and development sessions, and team business case presentations.
Build an intern community through peer intern groups, mentors, direct intern leaders, senior leadership throughout the summer.
Preferred Majors: Pursuing Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, Information Technology, Management Information Systems or related field, with a graduation date between August 2021 May 2022
The Teams:

This is a fantastic opportunity to be a part of a cutting-edge technology team. We are looking for an intern who wants to be involved in a little bit of everything but most importantly, loves to learn.
You could be part of one of six teams next summer:
As a software engineer intern on the API team in our Sterling VA tech hub, youll work hands on with a high performing API Services team focused on building products for millions of customers. Your internship with the API team will be a deep dive into what it takes to make it in the field of integration and API design/implementation today. You will be given the opportunity to help with all areas of the API Design process from interface modelling, prototyping, information architecture, backend system design, integration testing, and product engineering.
The Collaboration Services team is looking for future software developers to help build complex software applications that support collaboration as Asurion, utilizing the latest technologies from Microsoft and Amazon cloud environments, to name a few. This opportunity seeks to challenge and grow your technical expertise through solution development and mentorship from Asurion senior software engineers.
The Digital Experience Engineering team is responsible for building the systems that support our Device Protection customer interactions in the digital channels, including web and communications. We focus on providing a great and efficient user experience, helping our customers get back up and running when things have gone wrong.
Your internship will explore one of the many unique problem areas we have in the fraud space. You will have the opportunity to research a real-world problem then develop and implement a solution, but you wont go it alone. Experienced Software Engineers will partner with you and provide guidance during your journey.
The Retail Device Protection team is looking for a strong team player to provide premier support solutions with optimum use of technology; digital applications to protect their privacy and provide security; and rapid replacement of lost, stolen, damaged or malfunctioning devices. Asurion partners with the leading wireless companies, retailers and service providers enabling them to focus on their businesses and to provide services that delight their customers.
The Soluto Software Engineering interns will work hands on in an environment which fosters creativity and problem solving. We are not looking to create yet another web app. We need audacious people who can collaborate with product and interaction designers to realize bold solutions. We dont just write code. We want to inspire our 300+ million customers to get the most from technology.
Requirements:


Academic or hands on experience with one or more programming languages, including but not limited to: JavaScript, React, HTML, CSS, SQL, Node.js, Java, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, jQuery
Enthusiasm for problem solving, learning and collaborating with others
Desire to become either a full-stack software engineer, back-end software engineer, digital experience engineer
Responsibilities:
As a member of our team, you will not just observe, but be an active participant in collaboration sessions, design jams, workshops and design sprints as well as daily standups, retrospectives, & team outings.
Interns will collaborate with our cross functional team composed of Product Managers, UX designers, developers, and quality automation engineers to build features and enhancements for our products.
As a member of our team, you will not just observe, but be an active participant in collaboration sessions, technical designs, retrospectives, daily standups as well as writing code.
Document and present solution designs/approaches to supervisors and other members of the team.
Youll help us find new ways to make our processes more efficient and consistent. This cuts down on errors and gets stuff done faster.
Transform ideas, business opportunities, research and creative vision into tangible assets that provide clear, usable, useful and desirable outcomes for users.
Gain comprehension of existing deployment process and engineer automation where possible.
Research and develop proof of concepts to help solve exiting business and tech problems.

Position Summary

Samsung is a world leader in Memory, LCD and System LSI technologies. We are currently looking for exceptional software and hardware talent to join our Samsung Austin R & D Center (SARC) in Austin, TX and our Advanced Computing Lab (ACL) in San Jose, CA. SARC was established in Austin, TX in 2010 to be one of Samsung’s strategic investments in high performance low power ARM based device technology. Presently our GPU design teams, located in Austin (SARC) and San Jose (ACL), are developing a GPU that will be deployed in Samsung mobile products. Our System IP team located in Austin (SARC) is working on Coherent Interconnect and memory controller architectures.

Role and Responsibilities

We are seeking software engineers with a strong background in C, C++ based web, mobile or computing architecture applications- various graphics driver, and compute algorithms relevant to mobile GPU’s. Depending on your area of interest and expertise, you’ll work on GPU projects in the areas of: simulation architecture, performance modeling/ analysis, modeling framework design development, software optimization, modeling infrastructure and tools.

Experience Requirements:
Pursuing a degree in Computer Engineering or Computer Science or related field of study with a minimum of 3.5 GPA
Strong programming skills in C, C++, algorithms, data structures, and scripting languages
Knowledge of OGL API, OGL app development, OCL API and GPGPU compute
High level shading language, e.g. HLSL, GLSL
Simulation, modeling
Understanding of debug support
Knowledge of games engines, benchmarks, key applications, popular graphics architectures
Skills and Qualifications

• Acquires and applies job skills and learns the company policies and procedures to complete assigned tasks that are routinely/semi-routinely in nature• Normally follows established procedures on work. Requires instructions on tasks• Typical entry point for high school or vocational college graduates

LineVision is an innovative smart grid company with an advanced sensor and analytics solution that offers electric utilities more reliability, capacity, flexibility and resiliency for their transmission lines.

We are seeking smart people who geek out about energy, data, and building things to work with LineVisions engineering team to assist with design, developing, testing, validating and manufacturing our next generation products. If youre a hands-on hardware hacker/budding engineer/firmware coding wiz, and passionate about building great products, we want you on our team!

Currently, we are bringing several new products to market, and need your help! Youll dig in, and take the lead on your tasks -- with mentoring and backup from our engineers and scientists. Since we are a start-up, day-to-day tasks can vary, but some of your activities over time may be:

Within a Month:
Learning how our products work, and about transmission line monitoring technologies in general.
Looking under the cover and getting familiar with the code and/or hardware.
Within Two Months:
Performing experiments on our devices to verify performance.
Testing new boards and assemblies. Digging in with test equipment to spot issues and help solve them.
Building up first-article devices, and providing feedback.
Finding weaknesses in our designs, and working with designers to solve them.
Exploring how to automate testing.
Within Four Months:
Documenting how our contract manufacturers can test our devices.
Working with our contract manufacturers to answer questions as they learn how to build our devices.
Building an automated test fixture so that our manufacturing partners can test our new devices.
And Beyond:
Contributing to our product development in firmware/electrical or mechanical design.
Setting up best practices for firmware QA and/or product testing based on what you learned from the above.
This individual will work with LineVisions Engineering, Science, and Manufacturing team and report to LineVisions Somerville office within the Greentown Labs startup incubator.

Right now, were all working remotely because of the COVID-19 situation. Were interested in hiring a candidate, even if we have to find a way for you to work remotely to start. Ideally you'd be close to one tech offices either in Somerville, MA or Boulder, CO.

Some qualifications/experience we are looking for:
Pursuing a degree or recent graduate in Engineering, Computer Science, or Physics
Hands-on experience with electronics and code. Comfortable with electronic test equipment, and can perform experiments.
Embedded Firmware development in C, RTOS, bare metal and/or Linux.
Product testing, Hardware/Firmware Testing
Scripting in Python to automate testing.
Ability to work and think independently and manage a project to successful completion.
Ability to conceive (with help), execute, document, and explain to technical and non-technical peers a laboratory-type experiment as we test our novel products and technologies.
Desire to participate in team events including, but not limited to: Drawful!, bowling, building robots, and coffee tastings
Extra Points For:
Electrical layout, circuit design, debugging.
Mechanical Design/CAD
Manufacturing and/or Quality
IOT/Edge Computing and Server Development
Data Analytics
Experience with Electromagnetics, LiDar, Computer Vision, Evaluating new technologies
Low Power off-grid solar devices.
If some combination of these things sounds like you, then lets talk! E-Mail apply@linevisioninc.com

Since 1992, Kingland's managed solutions have helped data-intensive, highly-regulated clients connect and protect their businesses. Clients in the banking and capital markets, public accounting, insurance, and retail industries look to Kingland to create solutions to manage data, risk, compliance, customer insight and more. POSITION SUMMARY

The Software Engineering internship (SEI) is open to students currently enrolled in a four year institution, in a Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Computer Science program. DTCC’s Compliance department is dedicated to protecting the firm against the risks of non-compliance with applicable laws and regulations and lapses in internal policies. Our main responsibility is the development and maintenance of DTCC’s compliance program and to provide enterprise-wide oversight and support to DTCC’s subsidiaries and business areas. Our interns support some of the department’s key responsibilities, among them:
Assist with the identification and evaluation of compliance risks associated with global requirements
Monitoring compliance with DTCC’s internal policies and procedures
Assist in the design and establishment of appropriate and consistent standards and controls
Coordinate monthly compliance metrics and prepare management dashboard reports
Support department record management efforts
Aid in projects as deemed priority by management
Qualifications:
Candidates must be working towards a bachelor’s or master’s degree in the following curriculums: Business, Economics, Finance, Accounting, Computer Science, MIS or Business & Technology Management, and graduating no later than May 2022
Experience working in Microsoft Office applications (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel)
Strong problem solving and analytical skills
Good written & oral communication skills
Ability to grasp new concepts
Proficient computer and technical skills (Particularly with Microsoft Office Suite)
Ability to work within a team environment
Strong interest in the financial services industry, with previous internship experience a strong plus
Candidates must have authorization to work permanently in the US without the need for sponsorship (now or in the future)
Candidates must have minimum of a 3.2 GPA to be considered
About our Internship Program:

DTCC offers 10-week summer internships for university students in several departments and locations around the globe. Internships are an opportunity to contribute to DTCC’s daily operations, while learning more about the company and the financial services and technology industries. As a summer intern, you’ll be aligned as closely as possible to a team that leverages your academic skills and considers your future career aspirations. Upon a successful summer, interns will have the opportunity to be considered for our new graduate program upon obtaining their degree, also known as the EDGE Program.

Here's what you can expect as a DTCC intern
Access to senior leaders
Workshops for skill-building and career development
Participation in employee resource groups
Team volunteering with local charities
A sense of community
Engage with DTCC this Fall

Meet and learn from our colleagues as we host a series of virtual events this Fall. Visit our careers site at rb.gy/s6vxic to learn more and RSVP for our events.

Recruitment Timeline
August – September 2020: Engage with us virtually and apply to our jobs
September – November 2020: Interview virtually and at one of our office locations
December 2020: Receive an offer and accept!
January – June 2021: Engage with our colleagues as you close out your school year
June 2021: Start the Summer Intern Program

position: IT & Computer Science Internship - Buffalo, NY
description:
This is not work experience, this is an opportunity to experience work.

An Intern is an investment in Moog’s future. The intern relationship provides a three-way benefit between the student, university, and Moog. It is an opportunity for the student to incorporate classroom learning into professional, real world situations. The student brings new ideas to Moog on how to tackle projects and challenges, while Moog benefits from fresh perspectives from the brightest students in their respective fields of study. By having the students work on actual programs, we also work towards solving our customers’ most difficult technical challenges.

Moog’s Corporate Group, in East Aurora, NY, is seeking IT and Computer Science students for Internships & Co-Ops!

As part of the Moog U.S. Internship Program, this position provides strategic and tactical support to programmers, analysts, project leaders, and end-users on application development. Information Technology (IT) work is carried out in support of Moog's engineering, manufacturing, business, and e-business activities.

The student will contribute to their respective departments with the application of standard techniques, procedures, and criteria in carrying out a variety of tasks.

The student will work on discipline-focused projects and tasks to enhance their collegiate learning experience, while providing meaningful contributions to the Moog IT Team(s).

Responsibilities
Contribute to the preparation and execution of key IT projects at Moog.
Provide input on project processes, strategies, and execution.
Operate as a multidisciplinary member of the team of creative, independent individuals.
Represent Moog in a manner consistent with its technical and professional reputation.
Work experience may include (but is not limited to) database administration, network administration, configuration management, SharePoint Administration, and operations.
Application development activities could include research, requirements definition, analysis, design, coding, testing and documentation.
The student may also be given opportunities to explore newer technologies or apply course training at Moog.
Basic Requirements
Enrollment in Bachelor's or Master's curriculum in Information Technology, or Computer Science, from an accredited university
Currently a 3rd year student or higher, strongly preferred
GPA of at least 3.0; exact GPA requirement will be specified by department
United States Citizenship, or the legal ability to work in the U.S., without company sponsorship
Students within the Moog U.S. Internship Program are expected to have a professional disposition, with effective communication skills, a strong desire to learn, a positive attitude, and the ability to work in a team environment.

EOE/AA Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

Business Data Intern

The Data Analyst role is responsible for the execution of all sales reporting needs that will drive inside sales initiatives for our dynamic outbound sales team. The teams success is linked to the effective, aggressive and detailed reporting and presentation of sales avenues nationwide. This is a data driven role in which analysis will drive company decisions and will provide opportunity for immediate impact on the business performance. MUST BE ELIGIBLE TO WORK IN THE UNITED STATES.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Work closely with Lead Generators to ensure mass volume of quality leads are being generated for the entire US market; current and desired future territories

Leveraging predictive analytics and advanced statistical techniques to drive strategic thought and decision making
Analyze market trends to proactively identify growing or shrinking markets and determine what factors, sectors, governmental regulations, etc. are causing market changes

Continually analyze sales and marketing effectiveness, identify strategic and tactical opportunities, and make recommendations to further profitability and growth
Socialize and network to build a consensus on best practices for measurement and analysis of sales and marketing
COMPETENCIES KSAs
Skilled in Microsoft Office Word, and PowerPoint with advanced skill level in Excel
Proficient in SQL or ability to become quickly proficient with training
Strong analysis aptitude
Communication proficiency
Understanding of project management principles with history of successful application
Thrives in an individual contributor role that offers autonomy
Ability to utilize logic-based problem solving for impactful recommendations
Demonstrate keen situational awareness within a teamed environment
Keen self-starter that has ability to confidently develop new insights that drive operations strategy and revenue growth in an ambitious environment.
Knowledge of sales cycle form generating leads through the closing of deals
Skilled in the development and presentation of insights and recommendations utilizing clean and concise communication
Must have a high degree of self-motivation with an internal desire to exceed expectations
Strong understanding of unit economics and profitability measures.
Experience in statistical analysis utilized to interpret and verify data
Strong attention to detail
Intellectual curiosity towards research with strong organizational and time management skills
Strong understanding of unit economics and profitability measures.

Minimum Experience: 2+ years' experience in technical data analysis, data science, or data warehousing

Experience in one or more of the following languages: R, C#, .Net Javascript

position: AMG- Asset Management Group Summer Intern Program
description:
Position Overview
At PNC, our people are our greatest differentiator and competitive advantage in the markets we serve. We are all united in delivering the best experience for our customers. As a(n) intern within PNC's Asset Management Group organization, opportunities are available throughout PNC’s footprint and could include: Alabama, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, Michigan, New Jersey, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, the greater Washington D.C. area and Wisconsin.

Job Description

Asset Management Group Undergraduate Intern

As a PNC Intern, you will participate in a "best-in-class" internship program. During this 10 week program you will have the opportunity to gain exposure to a specific line of business, expand the tools you need to launch your career, and complement your education with real-world job experience.

PNC’s Asset Management Group (AMG) is comprised of Institutional Asset Management, Wealth Management, Hawthorn and Investment Strategy and Services. We work with individual and corporate clients who have significant assets to develop sophisticated, customized financial solutions ranging from investment management and wealth planning to trust administration and private foundation management. AMG draws individuals who possess the following skillsets: strong desire to interact directly with clients, strong written and verbal communication skills, detail oriented, self-motivated, eager to learn and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.

Upon entering the AMG Internship Program, interns will join either Wealth Management, Hawthorn or Institutional Asset Management.

· Wealth/Hawthorn track: Wealth Management and Hawthorn are two segments that offer a complete range of solutions and strategies for individuals and families with significant assets. Advisors in Wealth Management and Hawthorn are responsible for developing client solutions and strategies, including lending, investment management, estate/retirement planning, and trust administration. PNC’s Wealth Management and Hawthorn team takes a team approach to servicing clients. The team of advisors includes Banking Advisor, Fiduciary Advisor, Investment Advisor, Wealth Strategist, Client Advisor and Relationship Strategist.

· Institutional Asset Management track: Institutional Asset Management is responsible for guiding corporations, governments, non-profits and investors to solutions that optimize every step in investing & retirement. The group is recognized as a national market leader - a premier provider and partner - with proven expertise, and differentiation in local delivery.

Opportunities are available throughout PNC’s footprint and could include: Alabama, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, Michigan, New Jersey, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, the greater Washington D.C. area and Wisconsin.

Learn more about PNC’s Summer Internships on www.pnc.jobs/students.

Job Profile:

Participates as an intern in the PNC summer internship program.

· Performs or assist the core activities of the group by applying knowledge learned to drive business results (e.g. deal, sales, or process support, internal or external customer interaction, or supporting internal projects). Works under supervision and may have limited approval and/or exception authority.

· Participates in social learning within the organization (e.g. identifies and networks with business representatives and peers, participates in mentoring, job shadowing and community outreach).

Required Education and Experience:

· Working toward Bachelor's Degree, Preferred business relevant majors (e.g. Finance, Accounting, IT, Economics, Marketing, Math, Statistics, HR, Management, Communications, Business Law, Psychology, Logistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Actuarial Sciences), sophomore or junior status, Minimum GPA 3.2

PNC provides equal opportunity to qualified persons regardless of race, color, sex, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status, or other categories protected by law.


Competencies
Accuracy and Attention to Detail – Understanding of the necessity and value of accuracy and attention to detail; ability to process information with high levels of accuracy.Analytical Thinking – Knowledge of techniques and tools that promote effective analysis and the ability to determine the root cause of organizational problems and create alternative solutions that resolve the problems in the best interest of the business.Effective Communications – Understanding of effective communication concepts, tools and techniques; ability to effectively transmit, receive, and accurately interpret ideas, information, and needs through the application of appropriate communication behaviors.Flexibility and Adaptability – Knowledge of successful approaches, tools, and techniques for dealing with changes and adapting to a changing environment; ability to adapt as needed.Information Capture – Knowledge of the processes and the ability to identify, capture and document relevant business information in an auditable, organized, understandable and easily retrievable manner.Initiative – Understanding of the value of self-motivation and initiative; ability and willingness to seek out work and the drive to accomplish goals.Products and Services – Knowledge of major products and services and product and service groups; ability to apply this knowledge appropriately to diverse situations.Self-Directed Growth and Development – Understanding of the necessity of continuous personal growth; ability to gauge one's strengths, limitations and interests, and use of this knowledge for purposes of performance effectiveness and self-development.
Work Experience
Roles at this level are filled by recent university / college graduates with little or no professional experience, but possessing relevant skills. Includes individuals joining the organization through a Corporate development/ training program. In lieu of a degree, a comparable combination of education and experience (including military service) may be considered.
Education
No Degree

Disability Accommodations Statement:

The PNC workplace is inclusive and supportive of individual needs. If you have a physical or other impairment that might require an accommodation, including technical assistance with the PNC Careers website or submission process, please call 877-968-7762 and select Option 4: Recruiting or contact us via email at pathfinder@pnc.com.

The Human Resources Service Center hours of operation are Monday - Friday 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM ET.

Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO):

PNC provides equal employment opportunity to qualified persons regardless of race, color, sex, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status, or other categories protected by law.

California Residents

Refer to the California Consumer Privacy Act Privacy Notice to gain understanding of how PNC may use or disclose your personal information in our hiring practices.

Must be authorized to work in the United States and not require sponsorship now or in the future.
